author: game.changer.wallet
title: Cardano Totem: Onboarding the World
description: Les utilisateurs vivant dans des zones sous-développées sont ceux qui profiteront le plus de Cardano. Pourtant, ils ne disposent pas de l'infrastructure nécessaire pour utiliser cette nouvelle technologie.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the challenge as it lowers the barriers of entry for underdeveloped communities in south america (communities that lack access to IT infrastructure). In these current days people that cannot access a smartphone will not be interested in Cardano (in general), as they will be more worried about the most basic necessities of life, so the impact is bound to be low. But this is likely to attract other economic classes like lower middle classes, which i believe should be the target market.
f6_assessments.q1: The team presented is highly skilled and experienced, this is verifiable not only from their CV's but also from the projects they have developed in the past e.g. the GameChanger wallet which i have used.  A succinct plan is presented showing what will be done and when and the timings seem realistic. A clear budget breakdown is also presented showing estimated man hour costs and material costs. The team has assessed some of the potential risks which is a re-assuring trait. Given their skills and plan presented it's highly likely that this team are able to implement this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Milestones and relevant KPI's are presented which will allow the community to audit progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
There is clarity about the problem, the solution, and how they relate to the challenge. This is a great idea to help newbies trying to understand Cardano and use ADA for the first time, which they can access from the app and learn and discover more about Cardano and Catalyst.
I like this suggestion because it will help more people to come to Cardano in less developed countries. Well-executed problem statement and solutions
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is described in great detail about the experience and capabilities of each member. It's great when people's LinkedIn information is provided. The proponent clearly has the knowledge and commitment required to execute the project. From a feasibility point of view, the team behind this proposal is quite active in the Cardano ecosystem and has given a timeline on how they intend to execute the project. There are a number of potential risks and challenges that have been identified and proponents were presented with several solutions to address some of them.
For the above reasons, I appreciate the feasibility of the proposal
f6_assessments.q2:
The stated budget is reasonable
  There is a simple roadmap that shows some of the milestones in 1 and 3 months of development, although it does not provide many details. The proposition has a strong fit potential, but I'd like to see some clearly stated goals taken to success.
The provided metrics can easily serve to audit and track progress in promises

f6_assessments.q0: The problem posed by this proposal is clearly stated and its solution seems coherent and realistic. It is fully in line with the criteria of the challenge, especially in the KPIs with the goal of On-boarding 50 people, but also with the idea that everybody in under served areas have access to fair finances. Starting with the experimentation in Argentina and in a will to extend it globally.Their positive impact seems to be a conscious one, not least through their sustainable development in their aim to reduce poverty. So it is clear how they will bring value to the ecosystem and more. Furthermore, this proposal has the potential for continuity and evolution to address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience of the team members is clearly explained, detailed and proven by links to the profiles. Their skills are coherent with the needs of the project and the budget seems very reasonable for the size of this proposal. A video is provided as well as their website and a particular link to their sustanaible development goal. The risks are clearly described with a solution provided. The progression of the project is clearly explained and addresses the technical aspects with time and in contextualised manner.The timetable seems realistic and detailed. The fact that they have already developed a prototype point of sale terminal in fund 5 is an advantage.
f6_assessments.q2:
The project plan is broken down into several stages with an expected launch date of 6-6-2022. All the informations seems realistic and makes sense. The KIPs make sense and correlate with the progression of the project stages. While providing measurable quantitative milestones for success. 
For the feedback of their progress to the community they clearly state that Jira will be used for project tracking. This could have been explained a bit more but is still acceptable.

solution: Un dispositif de comptoir pour l'embarquement, qui imprime un portefeuille en papier. Grâce à ce reçu, l'utilisateur peut interagir avec Cardano dans un lieu central.
